Column Comment.0: LAND RIGHT SUBTYPE: This column is used to enforce the relationship betweenLAND RIGHT and its subtypes. The value must be equal to the name of one of thevalid subtypes: LAND_AGREEMENT, LAND_AGREE_PART, LAND_LEASE,LAND_GRANTED_RIGHT, LAND_UNIT, LAND_UNIT_TRACT or LAND_TITLE.
Column Comment.1: LAND RIGHT ID: Unique Identifier for the land right. A land right is the rights youhave to land, regardless of how obtained. It may be owned outright, rented, aquiredby agreement or contract.
Column Comment.2: FACILITY ID: Number or code uniquely identifying the Facility.
Column Comment.3: FACILITY TYPE: A reference table identifying the codes classifying the facilityaccording to its physical equipment or principal service performed. Please note thatFACILITY_TYPE will eventually become a SUBTYPE and downsized to 30characters.
Column Comment.4: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.5: EFFECTIVE DATE: the date on which this row of data first came into effect from abusiness perspective.
Column Comment.6: EXPIRY DATE: the date on which this row of data is no longer in effect from abusiness perspective.
Column Comment.7: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.8: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.9: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.10: UNIT OPERATED INDICATOR: a yes / no flag indicating that this relationship resultsfrom unit operation.
Column Comment.11: LAND RIGHT FACILILTY CROSS REFERENCE TYPE: the type of relationshipbetween the land right and a facility, such as production, operations etc.
Column Comment.12: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.13: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.14: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.15: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.16: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.17: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.18: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
